column4: hi i am unable to find the .deb package for songbird... is there a repo for intrepid which includes this amazing software ?
i just use the binaried from the songbird homepage. (i only install it for a single user, not the whole system)

you ould remove it.. but i doubt if that will 'fix' anything..  try running it from a terminal. look for error messages.. you could some how reset all the gedit settings perhaps. It may be some messed up config/setting
it runs eventually using the gui but it takes lots of time and also hangs in between the loading
try terminal.. look for error.info messages.. Personally i use geany not gedit.
try a cheating fiance :)
nope.. never used it.. :)
its the best network vulnerability scanner out there !!!!!!!!
so? :) my network is a whole 3 pc's
understanding a network requires knowledge of how it works...enter nessus
nah - networks are all about the fat pipes! :P
ok but question still stands
that's strange...
not really. from what i recall reading the Person in charge of 'tor packages' for ubuntu  had other things to do and  theres no longer a maintainer. thus its gone.
lulz
it you mean the 'current working directory' its depends on how you are launching the terminal.
the prompt just shows the current directory
yeah, but in intrepid it used to originate at /home/username
it still does here.. so its how  you are launching it...
when i launch it using the applications menu the prompt is at ~ but when i use it by a custom keyboard shortcut it doesn't
the launcher  process is starting in / then. so  make the thing launch gnome-terminal 'some option here to be in whatever dir you want'
hey it worked i used the --working-directory=~ and it worked thanks for the advice
